verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
How long <S%H5704><s%> will it be ere ye make <S%H7760><s%> an end <S%H7078><s%> of words <S%H4405><s%>? mark <S%H995><s%>, and afterwards <S%H310><s%> we will speak <S%H1696><s%>.
Wherefore are we counted <S%H2803><s%> as beasts <S%H929><s%>, and reputed vile <S%H2933><s%> in your sight <S%H5869><s%>?

He teareth <S%H2963><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> in his anger <S%H639><s%>: shall the earth <S%H776><s%> be forsaken <S%H5800><s%> for thee? and shall the rock <S%H6697><s%> be removed <S%H6275><s%> out of his place <S%H4725><s%>?
Yea, the light <S%H216><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be put out <S%H1846><s%>, and the spark <S%H7632><s%> of his fire <S%H784><s%> shall not shine <S%H5050><s%>.
The light <S%H216><s%> shall be dark <S%H2821><s%> in his tabernacle <S%H168><s%>, and his candle <S%H5216><s%> shall be put out <S%H1846><s%> with him.
The steps <S%H6806><s%> of his strength <S%H202><s%> shall be straitened <S%H3334><s%>, and his own counsel <S%H6098><s%> shall cast him down <S%H7993><s%>.
For he is cast <S%H7971><s%> into a net <S%H7568><s%> by his own feet <S%H7272><s%>, and he walketh <S%H1980><s%> upon a snare <S%H7639><s%>.
The gin <S%H6341><s%> shall take <S%H270><s%> him by the heel <S%H6119><s%>, and the robber <S%H6782><s%> shall prevail <S%H2388><s%> against him.
The snare <S%H2256><s%> is laid <S%H2934><s%> for him in the ground <S%H776><s%>, and a trap <S%H4434><s%> for him in the way <S%H5410><s%>.
Terrors <S%H1091><s%> shall make him afraid <S%H1204><s%> on every side <S%H5439><s%>, and shall drive <S%H6327><s%> him to his feet <S%H7272><s%>.
His strength <S%H202><s%> shall be hungerbitten <S%H7457><s%>, and destruction <S%H343><s%> shall be ready <S%H3559><s%> at his side <S%H6763><s%>.
It shall devour <S%H398><s%> the strength <S%H905><s%> of his skin <S%H5785><s%>: even the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> his strength <S%H905><s%>.
His confidence <S%H4009><s%> shall be rooted out <S%H5423><s%> of his tabernacle <S%H168><s%>, and it shall bring <S%H6805><s%> him to the king <S%H4428><s%> of terrors <S%H1091><s%>.
It shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> in his tabernacle <S%H168><s%>, because it is none <S%H1097><s%> of his: brimstone <S%H1614><s%> shall be scattered <S%H2219><s%> upon his habitation <S%H5116><s%>.
His roots <S%H8328><s%> shall be dried up <S%H3001><s%> beneath, and above <S%H4605><s%> shall his branch <S%H7105><s%> be cut off <S%H5243><s%>.
His remembrance <S%H2143><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%> from the earth <S%H776><s%>, and he shall have no name <S%H8034><s%> in the street <S%H6440><s%> <S%H2351><s%>.
He shall be driven <S%H1920><s%> from light <S%H216><s%> into darkness <S%H2822><s%>, and chased <S%H5074><s%> out of the world <S%H8398><s%>.
He shall neither have son <S%H5209><s%> nor nephew <S%H5220><s%> among his people <S%H5971><s%>, nor any remaining <S%H8300><s%> in his dwellings <S%H4033><s%>.
They that come after <S%H314><s%> him shall be astonied <S%H8074><s%> at his day <S%H3117><s%>, as they that went before <S%H6931><s%> were affrighted <S%H270><s%> <S%H8178><s%>.
Surely such are the dwellings <S%H4908><s%> of the wicked <S%H5767><s%>, and this is the place <S%H4725><s%> of him that knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not God <S%H410><s%>.
